Proud Boy on house arrest in Jan. 6 case disappears ahead of sentencing  —  Authorities are searching for a member of the Proud Boys extremist group who disappeared days before his sentencing in a U.S. Capitol riot case, where prosecutors are seeking more than a decade in prison, according to a warrant made public Friday.

DeSantis meets privately with Kemp in Georgia  —  The meeting follows Donald Trump's indictment in the state.  —  Ron DeSantis met privately with Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp on Friday, the latest in his effort to fortify relationships with three Republican governors alienated by Donald Trump.

James Buckley, conservative politician and U.S. senator, dies at 100  —  In political circles, Mr. Buckley was perhaps best remembered as the lead plaintiff in a landmark campaign finance lawsuit — Buckley v. Valeo — that in 1976 unraveled part of the post-Watergate regulation of political money

Rupert Murdoch encouraged Virginia's Glenn Youngkin to seek presidency  —  CORRECTION  —  A previous version of this article incorrectly said that Fox News settled a lawsuit by Dominion Voting Systems for nearly $788 billion.  The settlement was for nearly $788 million.  The article has been corrected.
